body_html:
Because the order of submodule of your module doesn't really matter for most things. The only important thing is what code you have in forward. If this code doesn't use the new submodules, they are not needed for anything.

Thanks for the PR and feel free to post more questions on our forums.
body_text:
Because the order of submodule of your module doesn't really matter for most things. The only important thing is what code you have in forward. If this code doesn't use the new submodules, they are not needed for anything.
Thanks for the PR and feel free to post more questions on our forums.
body:
Because the order of submodule of your module doesn't really matter for most things. The only important thing is what code you have in `forward`. If this code doesn't use the new submodules, they are not needed for anything.

Thanks for the PR and feel free to post more questions on [our forums](discuss.pytorch.org).
